learning_outcomes.description: Use ideas such as linear equations, the superposition principle and separation of variables to solve a range partial differential equations.
Use various notions related to Fourier analysis to find and manipulate Fourier series for a range of functions.
Solve simple boundary- and initial-value problems, among them the wave equation, the heat equation and Laplace's equation.

assessments.task_description: Each assignment is equally weighted. You must submit detailed written solutions to a collection of mathematical problems.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments must be downloaded from the Blackboard website and must be submitted ONLINE through Blackboard. Assignments need to be prepared as a single pdf file, either by typing it or by scanning your handwritten work.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 13(02 Sep - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Fourier Series and PDEs

3 face-to-face Lectures a week in weeks 7-13 of the semester. Linear PDEs and how to solve them. Fourier series for a given function. Fourier's Method of separation of variables and superposition. Boundary and initial value problems for equations such as the Laplace, heat and wave equations.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Fourier Series and PDEs 3 face-to-face Lectures a week in weeks 7-13 of the semester. Linear PDEs and how to solve them. Fourier series for a given function. Fourier's Method of separation of variables and superposition. Boundary and initial value problems for equations such as the Laplace, heat and wave equations.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 8 To Week 13(09 Sep - 27 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Problem Solving

One Tutorial per week in which a tutor demonstrates problems on the board and is available to answer questions about the tutorial sheets and assignment problems. There will be No tutorials in Week 7 and tutorials will start in Week 8.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
